```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

[[CLICK LINK HERE]](http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com)

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:


```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

```{r, include=FALSE}
head(cars)
tail(cars)
```



## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.


## Heading: Bullet Point

- Bullet point 1: put a space between '-' and text
- Bullet point 2
   - Sub-bullet point 1: push the 'tab' in
   - Sub-bullet point 2


## Numbered point

1. Number 1
2. Number 2
3. Number 3


- Plain text, as is
- Bold: **Bold**
- Italics: *italics*
- [Links](markdown.rstudio.com)
- 'code'

Supersript: `superscript^2`
Subscript: `susscript~2~`
Strikethrough: `~~strikethrough~~`

Header 1: `# Header 1`
Header 2: `## Header 2`
Header 3: `### Header 3`
Header 4: `#### Header 4`
Header 5: `##### Header 5`
Header 6: `###### Header 6`


```{r}
library(stargazer)
stargazer(mtcars[1:5, 1:5], summary = FALSE, type = "text")
```

```{r echo=TRUE, results ='asis'}
library(knitr)
kable(mtcars[1:5, 1:5], caption = "A knitr kable.")
```

```{r}
knitr::include_graphics("Italy.png")
```
